title.narrative: MEDIA ENGAGEMENT

description.narrative: Increased engagement with media at federal, state and community levels and other public platforms to facilitate behavior and social change and promote the rights of children in Sudan, which contributes to Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Evidence and coordination enables government, communities and partners to improve capacity and systems for equity-focused funding, advocacy , policies & legislation, strategies, planning & supply chain management to scale up results for children.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Increased engagement with media at federal, state and community levels and other public platforms to facilitate behavior and socialchange and promote the rights of children in Sudan

description.narrative: Public advocacy, communication & engagement has been scaled up, mainly on social media platforms and through key advocacy events and the increased engagement with various partners including children, media, private sector and civil society. However, the MER section faced challenges in the implementation of its annual strategy. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:16/01/2018

title.narrative: Number of platforms strengthened/created for adolescents to socially engage and advocate for for adolescents rights

target.value: 2017:10 (offline and online) high schools and higher institutions of learning

title.narrative: number of media products developed
Number of state and community level media with capacity to facilitate behaviour change
Number of media articles on child rights related issues (measure against UNICEF mention)

baseline.value: 300 (newspaper articles on health nutrition, education and protection)

title.narrative: Number of potential impressions on social media networks

baseline.value: Reached on twitter:90.1K, Reached on facebook:2000, Reached on Youtube:799

target.value: 2017:Reached on twitter:600K; Reached on facebook:7000; Reached on Youtube:3000

title.narrative: Number of online supporters

baseline.value: facebook (new likes):7000, witter (new followers):3900, Youtube(new subscribers):8, Website visits (new):60

target.value: 2017:facebook (new likes):15000; witter (new followers):10000; Youtube(new subscribers):1000; Website visits (new):1500
